Hashida Private Dining.
Chef Hatch is having his pop up restaurant here at OUE Social kitchen in a casual cozy setting.
- We had the Omakase course and I sort of lost count on the number of times that was served 😆
- Service by his crew was impeccable, with little details well taken care of.
- We were very well pampered and I made sure I booked my spot for next month before leaving 👍🏼

This is my third time to attend her cooking classes.  This time is the Chicken Xiao Long Bao.  It is awesome and the Chef Payal is the Best.  Her class is well organized and I learnt a lot from making the chicken stock to how to make dumplings. Of course, the Xiao Long Bao is seriously delicious and juicy! Highly highly recommended her cooking classes to everyone!  👍
Nice place to host birthday party! U can do your cooking here with every kitchen essentials are provided. The best part is u can just leave after party and someone will do the cleaning up. NICE!

Great concept! Affordable cook your own lunch with team mates / dinner with friends session in a condusive small group environment. Our session was a paella night, $60 per group of 5. As shown, paella kit was provided. Totatally enjoyable...we went hungry, waiting and salivating. When its done, we just ate right from the pan at the induction stove. Every group will somehow find their own cosy corner. Small pot of paella yet satisfying return for everyone.  Friendly instructor and crew who will drop by to guide you when you need a tip or 2 during the cooking process.

Booking was promptly responded and payment was easily done through bank transfer.

Thumbs up and definitely recommended! =)

[Added - Mee Hoon Kueh lunchtime session. Awesome fun during lunchtime...though it states 45minutes in total, prepare for 1.5hr to cook and enjoy your masterpiece and hangout for awhile at OUE social kitchen.

We attended the dumpling cooking class and learned how to make dumblings with 3 different fillings from scratch (we even did the dough ourselves). It is a lovely place, the session was well organized and the cooking stations are spacious and well equipped. We will definitely try it again at home 😊 - highly recommended!
Fun concept for a gathering. Cook & eat together. Best thing is fuss free after cook, you don't need to clean up the mess. Haha!
Great venue for team building! Highly recommended. Thanks Kingsley for facilitating the session !!

Fun time with girlfriends! Cooking is fun when the dirty dishes disappear as you put them in the sink!  Chef Elsie was very patient in explaining the steps and gave us tips on how to make full use of the ingredients. Thanks for the fun experience!

Well equipped but would have been a better for participants to have single hands on experience for the complete execution of the dish. Having to share a workstation with strangers limits the full range of the cooking experience and having to compromise on performance of others in the group. I didn't sign up for a corporate bonding event.

Tapas sharing concept, you can order some big and small plates to share. It all adds up quite substantially though so probably would recommend only for occasions you are prepared to splurge more. However it’s quite. A bustling environment. Dishes are quite innovative and delicious. Best to make reservations. Service is good.

Tried their live zoom cooking session last saturday.
Fun and relax session. Easy to follow as well.

Ingredient were delivered to me directly, which was great!

Recipe: Surf & Turf
Very nice kitchen facilities with chef and facilitators around for guidance always

Interesting place for a team or company activity - The cooking is simple enough to follow but any bits of experience will help. Ingredients are prepared in such a way that the most difficult parts are already done for you.

Love this place. Great for team bonding, family bonding or just a fun gathering with friends. Love the concept, affordable pricing, and best of all, no cleaning after cooking. Will definitely be back.
Amazing event team offering a range of cooking lessons, super organised and the recipes are easy to follow!
The chefs are helpful here. We came for a corporate event. The ingredients are measured out already.
Friendly and nice staffs! Fun time gathering! Will definitely come back again!
A very fun and interactive team bonding place. A must try social and corporate event...
The kitchen that looks like a makeshift kitchen shouldn’t be used at all. There’s no proper ventilation and the setup is a mess.
Friendly staff paired with a sleek yet cosy environment for cooking.
Interesting! A great way to bond with colleagues! Kudos Social Kitchen!
Very good staff and experience!!! Good time for team bonding
nice environment and had fun time. love it
One day event - Kueh Appreciation Day
it was a fun and interactactive experience.
Yay, fun!
Nice place for cookery classes
Good place for kitchen training
Fun, interactive and yummy!
Great fun
Fun and fantastic😬😬
Fun
Great experience

(Translated by Google) Neat and clean, open

(Original)
整洁干净，开放

Their signature duck was extremely good, however the rest of the dishes were rather mediocre. The crab and fish maw soup had barely any crab meat in it; it was probably too finely shredded you couldn’t see or even taste it. We had to add lots of vinegar into the soup else it’ll be bland.

The sauce of the barramundi went well with it, ensuring there wasn’t a fishy smell or taste to it.

The decor inside is really nicely set up, with dimmed lights to make the ambience cosy and intimate. Ladies, it can get quite chilly.

For the kind of price you pay here, you can easily get better quality Chinese cuisine elsewhere. It was a nice experience nevertheless!

Stayed at the Duxton and ate here for dinner one night. Had two different soups (both good but their hot and sour soup was very very good), their signature roast duck (one of the best in town), a tofu dish (forgot the name but goes great with rice) and a simple vegetable (simple but cooked perfectly). We had white rice which came undercooked but we forgave them due to how good everything else was. Noisy and crowded but it was a Friday night so happy we opted for an early dinner. Our only bugbear were the crowds (good for the restaurant but a little worrisome for us in these COVID times). We would have gone back except for that. The duck is probably the best we've had in S'pore.

I celebrated my wedding anniversary here and ordered lovely dishes. We ordered four dishes: Fried Lion's mane mushroom, Crispy Sichuan chicken, Iberico pork cheek and braised Sichuan tofu. My favourite was the Lion's mane mushroom. It was simply delicious. The service was very good, maybe the restaurant was mostly empty. If the restaurant is full, one may experience staff shortage. Overall, nice experience.

Very nice ambience and friendly waiters.

Dinning areas are decorated with a mixture of Oriental & Western feel, very comfortable.

Best food will be the Roast Duck, very succulent. Following fried prawn 🍤 with Bonito Aioli. Crabmeat Ee-fu Noodle 🍜 is nice.

We tried the festive coursed menu and ordered some items a la carte.

The festive menu had some really outstanding items, and some below average ones. The ice cream dessert with honey was out of the world.

From the a la carte menu, we really liked the pork cheek appetizer, and the roast duck. The steamed Chilean sea bass was a complete dud - wayy too garlicky and one dimensional.

Lovely interiors though it looks dark and foreboding on the outside. Service staff were polite and attentive on a Sunday lunch. Though there about 5 tables of guests, we were informed the restaurant was packed and dishes would take a while to come. Most enjoyable dish was the signature roast duck. Iberico pork cheek and Sichuan popcorn chicken were not excessively spicy. Efu noodles were pleasant and crabmeat egg white fried rice packed a nice flavour. Portions were small overall. The only dish that was underwhelming was the red bean pancake that was doughy and not crispy.

Chose a chinese restaurant for our National Day dinner!

Has been recommended to this restaurant by many of my friends, we reach there early to make sure we can secure a parking space.

Yellow Pot at Duxton Reserve

We were very impressed with the Decor, I would categorised it as the Oriental Black Style but immediately after we settle down, we were disturbed by a group of Chinese Boys (tourist), tons of vulgarities and loud noise diffuse throughout the restaurant. Disappointed at their behaviour at such a classy and exquisite restaurant. Almost destroyed our dinning experience.

Let’s talk about the food.

We were informed that the food will take a bit of time to prepare and our first dish came out after 30 mins. But we were not disappointed with the food quality, the appetizer was Fried Prawns with Sesame Mayo, the big and crunchy prawn with the well-balanced Mayo sauce was a perfect match. This is follow by 2 soups, Double Boiled Chicken Soup and Crabmeat and Fish Maw. My wife love the crabmeat and fishmaw as it taste similar to her favourite sour-spicy soup. The chicken soup was great too, it comes with an abalone and it sure has been cooking for hours to attain this level of flavour.

The 2 mains we ordered were the Signature Roasted Duck and Fermented Red Wine Yeast Chilean Seabass. The duck was the purpose of this trip and it does not disappoint, crunchy and thin skin pair with the soft and savoury meat, simplify delightful. My wife love the seabass, it is a very small portion and quite salty therefore I would recommend that you pair the fish with some rice.

We also ordered the Freshly Peeled Crabmeat Fried Rice, with the price, I was expecting more crab meat but nonetheless, it taste awesome. You can eat the fried rice just on its own (without any side dishes).

Our dessert, Crispy Pancake with Red Bean Fillings, to my wife surprise, this was the best dish of the day. It looks ordinary but once you put a piece into your mouth, you will stop at nothing to eat the whole plate. It was that good! A Must Try

Rating: 8.5/10

If you are hungry for awesome chinese food with an amazing decor, look no further.

#duxton #duxtonreserve #yellowpot #chinese #oriental #crab #duck #soup #abalone #redbeanpaste #seabass #seafood #prawn #fishmaw #simonlew #simonreview #foodreview #nationalday #sg #dinner

I liked the food and decoration, but service was not ideal. No one welcomed us after we sat and we had to wait for the menu. Although Waiters and Waitresses were walking around. Our dishes were not served together.

came here for dinner during weekdays.

maybe due to the sectional designed of the restaurant, it’s difficult to get attention and one ordered dish was missed out too.😓

wanted to try the Signature Roast Duck but was ran out.  Mango Sago ran out too.😅

the Crab & Fish Maw soup and the Fried Sesame “Wuxi” Pork Ribs were good!😋

the dark ambience and the decor are very unique.

"An ode to Bond girl turned interior designer Anouska Hempel", and therefore quite the spot to find our chimps on ladies night. We swung over to this utopia of sophistication for our fix of pre-dinner cocktails and experienced modern Chinese creations with an emphasis on sustainability.

We loved their signature roast duck as a bar snack on a previous visit, and had returned for a full portion this time. It was therefore disappointing that the duck had sold out even before dinner time. We feel that any self-respecting restaurant should never run out of their signature dish. That is, after all, what many of the customers come for.

Here's our very own "monkey head" rating (out of 5):
Food: 🙉🙉🙉
Hot and sour soup: 🙉
Crispy chicken skin: 🙉🙉🙉🙉🙉
Beef tenderloin: 🙉🙉🙉
14-day aged tofu: 🙉🙉🙉
Ambience: 🙉🙉🙉🙉
Drinks: 🙉🙉🙉🙉🙉
Service: 🙉🙉🙉🙉

P.S. The chicken skin was our highlight of the evening as the main courses left quite a bit to be desired. Incidentally, the hot and sour soup was neither hot nor sour. 😂

Chinese fusion food. Servings are good for 4 pax. Enjoyed prawn bonito aioli, wuxi pork ribs, lamb tenderloin and roast duck. Quiet ambience and private seating. Highly recommended and wiuld definitely return

Really cozy n beautiful place for nice Chinese fusion food.  Gd portion for ladies to share as well as the soup too. Service is excellent too n thank you for going the extra mile to get us the cake for mini celebration.

Food was great. We started with the tomato, it was refreshing, mildly sweet and a little tart, a great way to whet your appetite at the start of the meal. The beef was really really good, topped with fried slices of garlic, roasted like a teppanyaki style. Overall all the dishes were good, overall a very enjoyable range of food. The desserts were not overly sweet, balanced and a great way to leave the meal without feeling too heavy. The service was really good.

The ambience was really nice, modern without being too cold. My only critique is a lack of ambient music to set the mood.

Regarding the service, I guess much of the reviews were from a long time ago, but my experience here was amazing. The staff was attentive and anticipates your needs. We went for a birthday and when we needed the cake, we only needed to look at the staff and the Caucasian staff immediately understood. And even suggested the right portion of desserts for our party. Really appreciate his attitude and level of service. Salute.

Highly recommended place.

My second time here. Ordered set meals. It is good at the beginning when portion is small, pretty and fine-diningish. Signature tomatoes is unique and refreshing. Portion becomes bigger towards the end. Pork and fish are good, but there is an apparent lack of creativity in the taste and presentation. It feels the same as what you will get from a good tzi char restaurant. For a restaurant with an ambience like this, I expect more. Just when my friend and I were wondering why the last few dishes came in such big portion and mediocre presentation (and no longer fine dining-ish), the waitress delivered the final nail in the coffin with the final tofu coming in two shockingly big portion for the two of us. Nothing concise or pretty about the dish. By the time the almond tea came, it’s too late to save the day.

Decor is gorgeous if you like a lush moody feel, but the restaurant’s food and service are not worth returning for, unfortunately. We had the beef tenderloin (best dish), roasted duck (skin was good but I’ve had better duck elsewhere), truffle rice (tasted more like risotto but nice), soft shell crab entree and seasonal veg (both no big deal). We were underwhelmed and didn’t order dessert. Food took a while to arrive, perhaps because the restaurant was crowded at 6pm. Service needs more attention as it was uneven. As someone else mentioned in their review, the design of the place also makes it difficult to catch the wait staff’s attention.
We ordered the set dinner for two... None of the dishes disappointed us... All were good and very rich in flavour... Overall a great meal...

Had a fantastic breakfast here as part of our staycation. Everything is lovingly made in house from their croissants (SO good!) to their hollandaise and English muffins. The coffee is also excellent. Service was top notch, too, kudos to the kind and professional team! Only regret is we devoured the eggs Benedict before we could take a pic :) it comes with a hearty portion of prosciutto and spinach and was served with perfectly poached eggs.

A modern asian cuisine - enjoyed the food here! The roasted duck’s skin is super crispy I can’t forget how good it is! The lamb is tender and has a great flavour to it. The Seafood XO fried rice that we ordered was pretty amazing too. The atmosphere was great, pretty private, its a good place for gathering too as they have private section for bigger groups. Would highly recommend if you are into exploring new experiences.

Wonderful modern Chinese cuisine - very private place. Beautifully decorated. Service is very good. The portions are relatively big - so it can be a good sharing set with a group of friends. I personally like their duck cuisines; very tasty.

Clad in the striking palette of black, gold and yellow by acclaimed British designer Anouska Hempel, this is one restaurant designed with Instagram in mind.

Helmed by Executive Chef Sebastian Goh who uses only healthy ingredients with no MSG. Our favourite dishes include the braised eggplant, roasted duck and the XO fried rice. Each dish is priced approximately $40, so a meal is roughly $80 per person without drinks.

Marriott Bonvoy members get dining discounts and points.

Food was very delicious. Love the ambience. Service was excellent. Shout out to their Duxton Mary, it's the bloody Mary cocktail but way elevated served with a side of really delicious salsa-ish kind of salad where you can eat it separately or chunk everything into the cocktail and drink and still yummy!!
Place is nice and classy. Service is  really excellent. Only the food was very disappointing. I hope they will improve on the taste.
The service was excellent. We were hosted by Ivan who check in regularly with us to see if the food is alright. The dishes we order taste great and the ambience were nice.

We had a great evening here. Nice food, great ambience. The service is good, staffs are patient and attentive. I like the tender and juicy pork cheek, crispy fish skin! My friends like their spicy Sichuan chicken... thought I requested less spicy, but it still very spicy to me. Btw, it's supposed to taste spicy 😅 so beware if you can't take spicy food. Hmm... feedback, the chicken is not crispy enough. Nothing to shout about on their Crabmeat Ee-fu noodles.
Hmm...Escape to Keifeng is good.

Kannan and his team were attentive to us the whole evening - ensuring that our needs were met and that everything was fine. The food was lovely too. Love the portion size so that we can try a greater variety of food too. However, big eaters may have to order more to fill their stomachs. We enjoyed the barramundi and sea bass as they are different from the usual. We love the kurobuta ribs too - soft, tender and falls off the bone. The children enjoyed the thin udon with tonkatsu broth so much that they were arguing for a second helping :) love the ambience and thank you for accommodating the children!

Thank you for the lovely evening!
A place where lights are quite dim, but food is good.

I don't usually give review. But this restaurant for the price and service really need improvement.  Service was bad, seems like understaff and we had to wait very long before the staff has time to attend to us. Food was so so only, nothing amazing. The duck to me was not very fresh, got a strong frozen duck smell. The rest of the dishes was ok. Considering the service, and food quality, this will be our first and last visit.

Went to YP for dinner last night .The food and the service was almost excellent The Duck ,the scallops ,fried rice and pancakes are fresh and tasty.
The decor and ambience really nice but unfortunately there was a table with 2 ladies and a man stole the show for the night . They were talking so loudly that I think the rest of the diners must be annoyed . They should have dine.in Broadway kopitiam! Hopefully when we come back we will have more considerate diners! No fault of the restaurant .

A hidden "pot" in Duxton. Chinese food with a little twist in a black gold theme restaurant.

Food portion is decent. Taste ok. Friendly staff too.

Thank you to Sandrine for the attentive service.
Between the first dish & white rice served, there was a 20 mins gap before the rest of the dishes came! We had expected much better from a Chinese restaurant in an award-winning establishment.

Had the dim sum lunch buffet today. There were many misses amongst the dishes we ordered.

Pork ribs tasted stale and dry. Very much like they were overcooked and left out for awhile. I need my pork to tear from the bone, soft, succulent and juicy. This was none of that 😣

Pomelo mango sago tasted too much of the packaged mango pudding 😣

Posh interior design and TOP-notch service by the crew today offered some redemption. Very attentive service 👍🏽 lovely place.

We made appointment for the 2nd-seating at 1.15pm. When we arrived at 1.15pm, we were told to “wait on the couch bcos the previous party has not left yet”. There was a time limit to our meal, last order 2.30pm. Not a first good impression. We made the effort to be punctual, could there be a better way to manage the previous patrons from the first seating? Something for the restaurant management to think about. The wait staff’s communication was that they were really helpless.

We also asked for a high chair during reservation but were told to wait, bcos “previous patron was hogging the high chair”. It honestly disappointed me when this mismanagement of the restaurant became a problem cascaded down to me- also a customer of the restaurant. When we left the establishment at 3.15pm, high chair was still not received.

Great ambience and food. They boast no MSG in their food, even the sauces are made from scratch. Highly recommended items include Beef Tenderloin Cubes and Stir Fried Meesua. Try their cocktails too. They have pretty unique concoctions. More reviews on my IG : @zanthrea.

Amazing Chinese food that's elevated. Great ambience, awesome service, and surprisingly good value. If you want good Chinese food but don't want to eat the same old jumbo and actually want to have good atmosphere and a modern twist, this is a great place.

I really enjoyed this place. The food was great the staff was just so nice. When you have a combination of good food with the excellent service you have a winner. I definitely recommend this place for your next business dinner or a romantic night with you loved one
Great food and service. Every dish was excellent in taste and presentation. A great place to bring visitors to Singapore to try the best of modern Chinese cuisine.
Staff are fantastic. Easter to assist and make sure you are happy. Great menu.
Absolutely stunning decor. Food was delicious 😋

Very good Chinese food but comes at a hefty price! Portions are small, like tapas servings. Service is good and server was able to recommend/advice dishes and it’s portions to ensure sufficient for our dinner party.

Crispy roast pork belly super yums! Szechuan spicy fried chicken and mee sua highly recommended! Egg plant dish too! Couldn’t think of an average dish as all of awesome!

Perfect for special occasions and suitable for business entertainment as the ambience is very stylish and luxurious.

IG @iambruisedlee

We've had a fantastic experience here twice now! We came for drinks and small bites one night, and had breakfast here on a separate occasion -- both were wonderful! Food quality was very high and service was attentive, but the absolute highlight was the quality of the cocktails! Very inspired Asian flavour combinations, one of the best bars we've been to in Singapore.

I just had my dinner last night and the experience was very disappointing. I ordered a 6 course dinner set at 8pm and the pace in which the dishes were served was so bad, the entire experience was ruined. The first 3 dishes came at 30 to 45 mins interval and the last 3 dishes in a burst because "the kitchen is closing". Toward the end,  my wife had 3 dishes on the table. How is this a fine dining experience?
The food was better than average, but wasn't particularly spectacular.
Nice ambience with alot to offer than known. Rustic dated back to old SG shophouses. Staffs are pleasant

Amazing Roast Duck. Heavenly proportion of crispy skin, just enough fat underneath the skin and juicy meat!

The restaurant is beautiful too!

Hands down to Chef Sebastian and the team, my favorite Chinese in Singapore! Love the Sichuan influence and the innovative twist. Wonderful setting as well in the beautiful Duxton Reserve hotel. Highly recommend!

For a place describing its specialty as clean eating, it was a massive disappointment. All three dishes we had were dark, spicy and heavy tasting. The interiors are pretentiously dark and service standards are straight out of a neighbourhood zhi char coffee shop.
Simply, don’t bother...

Service was great.
Noise level was not. Private room partitions are those flimsy Chinese screens which are not floor to ceiling and neither are they sound proof.

Food was disappointing for the price we paid. Food lacks the ‘omph’ factor. I would describe them as flat, bland and/ or spicy. As a local, you can get way better food at this price in a good Chinese restaurant, with good sound proofing. Most of the dishes we ordered are on the recommendations list. Imagine if we ordered the non recommended ones.

The best dish was the starter, Chilled Organic Vine-ripened Tomatoes.

There are some dishes taste ok but in general very salty. The most disappointing part is the service. The waitress ladies look extremely confused, multiple different staff randomly dropped by asking random questions such as “any of you ordered beer?” seriously... The tea tasted really bad. Really a horrible pot of tea honestly.
The crispy Sichuan chicken is nice! Good ambience

Great service and ambience. The duck and the beef tenderloin was very nice. I thought the enoki was something different, like a spiced snack which is q nice. The mee sua is also beautiful. Not a fan of the lion mane mushroom and avocado even though it was recommended.

I find the interior of this place beautiful because it is decorated in gold and black with pleasant ambiance. Best place for small group gathering of friends or family. Food is very delicious, we love the roast duck and the sweet and sour eggplant the most. The portion is generous and guaranteed that you will enjoy every bit. Excellent service by friendly staff. This place deserves a five-star rating.

Established in June 2001 as part of the Amara Singapore hotel's restaurants, Silk Road Restaurant serves culinary delights inspired by the historic trade route through China.
.
Ambience at Silk Road Restaurant has an understated Oriental elegance, refined yet quiet, suitable for business gatherings.
.
The spacious dining hall is spot lit, the light over each table lending sufficient illumination, while thoughtfully arranged comfortable furnishings and use of shadows create a sense of privacy for each table.
.
Service at Silk Road Restaurant is attentive and friendly. As there usually aren't that many diners here, staff can afford to devote time and care to guests, proactively refilling water and tea, and offering to clear finished plates throughout the meal.
.
Food at Silk Road Restaurant highlights Chinese Mandarin cuisine, spanning the regions of Sichuan, Beijing, Shanghai, and Shaanxi.
.
Dishes are well-executed with above average quality, making for a decent meal. Dumplings are a highlight here, with several different options.

Nothing special. Overpriced tho.

The sliced fish in chili oil was thickly coated in cornstarch. The knive cut noodles are decent but needed more salt.

After so many years, silkroad has managed to maintain its standard. The Peking duck was crispy on the outside and moist on the inside. Superb!

Dec 2021 - Nth time at silk road
Tried the cod for the first time. Not bad. Smooth. Will try again

Dec 2021 (again!) - scallops asparagus not as spicy as I hoped for but still good. Wasabi prawn with potato crisps were great! Half chicken was juicy and not dry. Love.

Great service, observant and meticulous. They took note and very careful with our special dietary order.

Great food with affordable price, generous portion too.

Classy ambience however noise from kitchen is a bit loud.

Vegetarian friendly.

Food is great and cosy restaurant setting. Attentive staff however they are pretty understaffed. Hopefully they will increase staff again now that it’s all opening up. We enjoyed the snowflake dumping and assorted mushroom dishes the most.

You need to call to order their peking duck in advance. Other dishes are just average, peking duck is not the best in sg too. But good option for less crowded and mainstream restaurant for big group dining.

-1 for the staff always asking us to top up and end up over ordering.
Fantastic service. Ordered Dan Dan Mian, Sichuan  chilli chicken and prawns. Great ambience and rates are very reasonable. Total value for money.

A quiet cosy place for authentic Chinese food. Personally, I find their mapo toufu is one of the best with good silky toufu and really good spicy sauce. As I asked for original flavor  and spicineess, I really experienced that spicky kick that made my forehead break into sweat on a cold rainy evening. A bit pricey but with the good quality food, I will definitely be back to try other dishes.

We come here for CNY reunion lunch every year. The food items taste good. The prawns are exorbitant in prices but I guess it’s the same for all seafood items in Chinese restaurants during cny. I would have given this full marks if not for the Nian Gao. It’s not fried and it taste very sweet and strange. I find the mango sago very sweet as well. Service is good as usual!

Went for team get together, booked VIP room, tried multiple dishes there, but none of them are so good except prawn and mushroom.. Last but not least, ever worst customer service, the way they respond, the way they service, much worst than the local food shop,, I think those lady serves are not getting paid correctly 😃

Mapo tofu is marvelous!
it's so spicy and hot but I can't stop eating it!
and there are a lot of traditional chinese foods, you must go there at once!

We've been here twice now. They serve a tasty range of Sichuan/Chinese fare including dim sum. I recommend their Sichuan-spiced roasted chicken. Note that some dishes can be extremely garlicky. Prices are decent for a hotel restaurant.
Located on the second floor of Amara Hotel, this restaurant serves enjoyable SzeChuan food. The spiciness of the food is moderate, and the starters are quite good.

This is the most authentic mapo doufu I have tasted in singapore. However, The Peking duck is rather bland and the skin is not even crispy. The only highlight of the duck dish is the sauce and the wrap which are both made by the chef delicately. I think Singapore does not have the real Peking ducks to be purchased.

Was having a business lunch there on Friday, 30th September. There were about 8 to 10 tables occupied but only 1 service staff. They were severely short-staffed, which resulted in slow to almost no service.
Great location and nice atmosphere. I was just invited to Chinese new year dinner by my friend. It's my first time to taste traditional Chinese new year's cuisine.

Went for the $88 pp CNY Lunch, at first they asked us to come earlier even though they had a booking slot for 2pm available on Chope, then when we got there, they were rushing dishes out so as to get us out of the restaurant ASAP. Together with the horrible customer service from the lady manager where she was rude, aggressive and unwilling to serve us, the lo hei/ yu sheng ended up giving the entire family food poisoning! I would honestly, not recommend anyone go back for their CNY Lunch or Dinner services if this is how they treat their customers on Chinese New Year
One of my top 3 Sichuan spicy diced chicken dishes in Singapore. Taste so satisfactory!
Pretty decent Chinese cuisine. Quiet and classy ambience.

The food is delicious and the portion is just right. Their service is good too especially Wendy Wong. She gives us good recommendation of their signature food and inform on the promotion offered in the restaurant. I would this place for all occasions.Had a fantastic lunch experience at Silk Road. The ambiance has changed and added to the lovely experience. Ms Wendy was excellent and recommended the lunch menu which was excellent

Been coming here for 3 years, and it is consistently very good. Love the shenyan dumplings, Mapo tofu, and Dan Dan noodles. Probably the best Chinese restaurant in Singapore. Lovely food and great service!

Great place for a quiet lunch during peak hour in the CBD area.

Tried their peking duck, it was slightly different from the usual dish, duck meat is sliced and wrapped together. Not as crispy but still good. Love their salted vegetable fish soup, thou it is slightly oily.

Came here for lunch on a weekday. The Captain was super warm and friendly. Tried some new dishes (braised luffa melon with crabmeat and crab roe; claypot snakehead fillet) this round, pretty yummy i might say! 谢谢阿京师傅。
Love mapotofu here. One of the best dish
Great Sichuan food, affordable prices, and good service
Very good service and unique dishes. Spicy diced chicken 辣子雞 and water boiled fish 水煮魚 are a must!!

Got to know this place when my friend bought me my birthday dinner in July this year. Since then, I have revisited this restaurant at least once a week unless I am out of town. Captain Wendy Wong remembered me on my 2nd visit which is a week apart from the first, and has been providing personalised service by addressing me by my name and take note of my order preferences.
Yummy 😋 Traditional Beijing Duck, meat very tender. Foodwise good and fresh. Very refreshing chilled Lemongrass Jelly with Yuzu Sherbet. Great service and friendly staff... Paulin, Rui Qing and Wendy
The food was a huge disappointment. I used to come here often a few years ago and nothing tastes the same now. They probably changed their chefs, and skimmed on the material. Service was top-notch.

The decor feels oldish and the service is not as good as those fancy looking, Michelin star bearing places, but the food here tastes as good or better without the pretentiousness. It is a place where I crash into alone after work, or bring my friends to, but not for treating my business partner with fancy wine.

We ordered the Har Gao (standard quality - shrimp is pretty fresh), Beancurd Roll (a tad too elastic and starchy for me, but my mom thought it was good), Xiao Long Bao (nice healthy mouthfuls with very delicate skin - fair quality and taste for at $5.40 per basket of 3), Beef Brisket Congee (very smooth congee, and very soft beef - better than the generic lean pork century egg congee), Char Siew Chee Cheong Fun (I prefer the ones at Tim Ho Wan, the skin is smoother and char siew is of better quality), half an Irish Roasted Duck (fantastic crispy skin with well-roasted fats), Asparagus stir-fried with Scallops (no photos, ate it too fast!) and salted egg yolk buns for dessert (these come baked in a delicious thin crust and loads of filling).

I gave it only 4 stars out of 5 because they only informed us the Irish duck was not included under the Chope Voucher promo (we paid $35 per $50 voucher, basically 30% discount) only after we had ordered everything (and we declared we were using the vouchers right from get go) and was midway through the dim sum, despite the T & C's in the Chope Vouchers stating that all a la carte menu items were included in the promo. I shared the Tofu Omelette, Claypot Chicken and Sambal Kang Kong with two others over lunch.

I liked the tofu omelette, it came out smelling of a really hot wok and was cooked just right, perhaps a little overcooked inside. Kang Kong tasted good. Important that the Kang Kong is young and texture not chewy. Now, onto the the restaurant's famous Claypot Chicken - chicken was well cooked through with meat falling off the bones, the cabbage was memorable, just one those good things that came with the claypot dish that completes it. Wish they had some mushrooms in the dish as it would have been complimentary to the chicken. The sauce which all of this sat in, is where I hesitate to say is really anything fantastic. It was a mild savory sauce that felt like watered down mix of Oyster sauce, soy sauce, etc. But I'd still go ahead and recommend this place to others as I think it's a basics no frills food place. Could the food be better? Of course, but its good enough to fix a hungry 3 people on a Saturday.

Tucked in a quiet corner on the 2nd level next to Tanjong Pagar hawker center, it is many times "Out of sight, out of mind" in its location.
After reading many positive reviews, I ordered a deep fried fish with rice.
The soup was added with milk and a  generous amount of deep fried egg, seaweed, tomato and leafy greens. Soup was good though not outstanding. 5 pieces of deep fried fish nuggets which were still piping hot. More crusty and it had a larger batter than the fish slice. Couldn't tell much of the fish type.
Aircon seating filled quickly but the  service is quick and friendly as they will try to get you a table at the outdoor (large fans were observed).
For the price, it is reasonable.

Value-for-money Quick-Lunch menu, Hainanese Pork Chop rice at $6 nett. The pork was tender and lean, with good portion size for the price. Sauce was a bit too sweet for me. Plus points for the friendly service and clean environment.
Ordered the Stir-Fry Kang Kong and Marmite Chicken. Both dishes were yummy. The chilli, both belacan and sweet and sour were nice.  Service was superb! Friendly lady. :)

Mixed fish soup (default comes with milk) was a hearty substantial bowl. Felt full even without adding rice or noodles. Soup and batang was as expected but fried fish was exceptionally good, light batter and huge chunks. Not sure what fish was used though, dory? Fish soup purists may automatically opt for the traditional batang soup but I'd say give the mixed one a try! Chilli with garlic also seemed homemade and was very good.
Yummy Teochew eatery on 2nd floor of Tanjong Pagar Plaza. The indoors space is tight, but extra tables have been set up outside and it’s quite comfortable / breezy place to eat. Will return !

Lots of choices to choose from. Tried the fried fish soup and it was very tasty. Fish is served separately in a bowl so it does not come soggy and soft. Also tried the fish meat white bee hoon. Freshly cooked and hot, very good. Will come again.

Hidden gem on the second floor of Tanjong Pagar Plaza. I wouldn’t have known of this place if it weren’t for a friend’s recommendation. Pork Chop Egg Fried Rice ($8) is great! Rice is fluffy and separated, pork chop is just nice, and chili is the real hero. Will definitely come again to try the other stuff!
Sliced fish soup was very authentic!!! Soup tasted nice and nutritious! Price was reasonable.
Friendly staff and tasty food! Sesame chicken is the best😋

second time here. the lady (probably the owner/family of owner) definitely has what it takes to run the biz. very friendly, and engages all her customers that she serves. she even sensed that i might have been uncomfortable sitting at the smaller table and gave us a bigger one without me askingg. i appreciate that gesture. food is good and reasonably priced too. definitely will come back again to try other dishes.

I packed dinner back. The dishes are simply delicious.

The Mixed fish Tom yum soup was nice, fish hor fun was tasty, and the fried rice with pock chop was simply good enough to fill m6 teenage son's food cravings.
So many ranges of good and tasty foods to select. Need to wait for at least 15-20mins. But it is worth waiting.
Situated at level 2 and beside the tanjong pagar food centre, one can find the store tucked to the left of the food centre. The food here is slightly more  pricey than the food centre but it is nice!

The owner prioritises the customers’ needs. For instance, we ordered an extra bowl of rice and the owner said to finish our food first and there’s no rush to pay. It’s really small actions like this that elevates the entire service level!

We tried the batang fish steamboat, marmite Chicken, furong omelette, minced meat tofu! All of the dishes are super nice! The prices are reasonable too!

Strongly recommend!

A new find for the family and what a surprise find! Delicious fresh Authentic food @ affordable prices. Dishes to try include the steamboat, har cheong Kai, prawn rolls fried pork! They may be opening a stall soon in Aljunied so hit them up there as well.

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content:
Love it!
I just got back from Jeju and was missing Tangsuyuk so much. Not black pork but I enjoyed the dish so much. $53 for Tangsuyuk, Mandu, Jjamppong & Jjajiangmyeon (SET A)
Bonus is that they have baijiu and also Korean alcohol available.

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content:
Wow I have never came across this restaurant even though I have walked past it without noticing it so many times until a Korean friend recommended me this restaurant.
I am usually a Korean cuisine person and not so much on Korean-Chinese but this restaurant totally proofed me wrong that Korean-Chinese can be very good too!
I walked in it just felt so Korean I believe there were a lot of Koreans dining there. I was brought into the corner room where the other 2 tables were also Koreans. I was thinking to myself this place must be good and authentic!
Went with my gut feeling to pick a set and added a Kimchi pancake. Food was served pretty promptly and smelled good.
The dumplings was hot and crispy, very enjoyable. Then came the kimchi pancake and the jajiangmyeon. Am pretty surprised the portion was rather generous thank God we got enough people to finish everything.
Jajiangmyeon is definitely the best I have eaten in Singapore, the sauce is so good and not salty at all. 2 of us shared the jajiangmyeon and we were quite full already didn't really we still had the Jjamppong. Soup was not really spicy and it was very delicious. Didn't know why after the meal my lips felt like it was burning. Forgot about the main star of the meal which I thought was the sweet and sour pork. Wow the sauce is so good, so mild but has the essential flavours and taste.
Really enjoyable meal here definitely will make it to the often visit list!

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content:
The food is delightful and outstanding. We highly recommend three must-try dishes that are great for sharing: Sweet & Sour Pork, Seafood & Vegetable Salad Platter with Mustard Sauce, and Jjam Bong (spicy seafood noodle soup).

Ambience wise, this is not the most stylish restaurant, but is cosy and evokes an old world feel which we liked.

Tip: Make a reservation for the window seats which feels cosier and more enjoyable with views to the sidewalk.

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content: Portions are hearty, kimchi and other small side dishes can be refilled. Not quite used to Korean style of Chinese dishes, taste OK But no wow factors.

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content: Tried the Dried Black Soy Bean Sauce Noodle (간짜장면) aka Dry Jjajangmyeon. Find it much better than the usual jjajangmyeon, less oily to my preference. The noodle is spongy and chewy. To go with that, we also ordered the Sweet & Sour Pork (탕수육). Very good! For some unknown reasons, these 2 dishes combo always appeared in korean dramas, especially after they moved house. If you like something for a change, go for the Seafood & Vegetable Platter with Mustard (양장피). Its like the CNY "Loh hei", just that you are mixing and tossing thinly sliced, fresh vegetables and seafood with potato starch noodles instead.

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content: Hwang Sil is a great place for Korean-style Chinese comfort food. Their noodle dishes are nice and the mains come in a range of sizes. They also have quite a few combos and set menus that include the most popular dishes. I recommend trying the kkanpunggi (깐풍기). The sweet and sour pork (탕수육) is also good.

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content: Visited the place for two times, and still amazed by how well-executed the noodles were!!! The noodles got a nice chew and very tasty! Most of the customers visited during lunch hour were Korean! I recommend Jjamppong the most!

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content:
A favourite of mine for jjangmyeon (blackbean sauce noodles) and tangsuyuk (sweet and sour pork) - which go very well together.

Fans of kkanpunggi (spicy garlic fried chicken) may also like to try that here; I like it although some may mot as it is slightly less crispy than other places but the seasoning is great.

Have not tried their other dishes to comment on them but an overall great place for a nice simple dinner.

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content: The tansuyuk and jajangmyeon here is good no doubt, just feels a little bit pricey. For a little better value, get one of their sets! E.g. set A includes dumplings, tangsuyuk, 2x mains like jajangmyeon or jjampong for $53 (before service charge and GST)

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content:
The jajangmyun compared to the other korean noodle shops is a lot more wet and less greasy. A good balance of sweet and savory, with a handful of onions and pork belly cubes. Noodles were chewy and didn't have an alkaline smell.

Tangsuyok ordered for Small is more than enough for 2 pax. They are in bite sized chunks instead of long streaks which was easier to eat. Batter is crispy and not too thick.

Texture of chives pancake was thin and lightly crispy. It is easily torn with chopsticks and still has a chewy stretchy texture. Can imagine eating this with alcohol as an accompaniment.

Condiments such as kimchi, yellow radish, onion bits and szechuan veggie were given in small portions.👍 And water is complimentary. Ambience was very much like an atas korean-Chinese restaurant :)

Total bill came up to be ~$72 and would say its towards the high side.

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content:
Went as recommended by my Korean colleague for Jjajangmyeon. First taste on Jjajangmyeon is not too smoky like OBBA or sweet like Mukjia. Noodles is in between Itaewon’s and OBBA. Find that smaller size onions taste better but here is bigger slice. The minced pork here is bigger in size and not so dry as compared to the other restaurants mentioned above. The sauce here is most watery of the 4.
For the fried dumplings, I must recommend. The skin is akin to biscuit taste n the fillings is good.

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content: Seafood jjumpong is very delicious, strongly recommend. Visited few times never disappointed. Another dish that impressed is spicy jellyfish salad, really yummy.

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content: Disappointing. This place was good and had recommended it to many people but the standard has dropped significantly. Jjajangmyeon didn't taste right - lack the sweet and salty balance - just tasted like a bowl of noodles with no purpose. Tangsuyuk tasted like how it was then but the sauce was too liquid like dipping into water. Itaewon Jjajang down the street might be a better consideration for those who want authentic Korean jjajangmyeon and tangsuyuk.

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content:
Jjamppong(짬뽕) and raw beef(육회) are the best in Singapore.
Other menus are also above average.

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content:
Best Ja jiang myeon I’ve eaten! A little pricey but definitely worth the extra few dollars for authentic Korean food.
We had to wait 30min for a seat and when we entered, we were the only Chinese in the restaurant! Well patronized by Koreans.. had to be good!

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content:
Safety Warning!
Foods were good, but their chairs were broken yet they decided still to use them (multiple broken chairs), which caused blackspot bruise injury to my index finger immediately. When I asked why they did not remove the broken chairs, they said, “no choice as we are still waiting for the new supply. The owner knows about it”  When I asked again if there was any one injured before, surprisingly yes there was… they rather prefer to get customers hurt.. just be careful… you can be the next person with bruise or even worse injuries.

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content: Very yummy jjajang myeon and jjampong. The tang soo yuk and fried mandu were the best I've tasted in Singapore. Will definitely be back for more.

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content: Visited on a weekday night 8pm. Ordered the set for 2 pax with spicy fried chicken cubes. The chicken cubed was delightfully crisp yet tender to Bite into and were flavourful. The Jjampong noodle was brim-filled with seafood but atad more wok-hei for the soup broth would certainly have brought the overall taste a level higher. Jjajīang noodle was slurpy and gd to have nothing much to comment nor complain abt since nt much ingredients for this noodle. Overall liked the service and overall foodfare and reasonably priced for korean noodle place in sg. Total paid $60 for 2 pax that will probably feed 3 so will recommend if one is in the area and craves korean Chinese food.

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content:
The portion is super generous

The jampong soup is so delicious
The sweet sour chicken is on point

Waiters are very attentive to your needs

Will come back again to try the other dishes

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content: The jajangmyeon (black bean sauce noodles) and fried dumplings (tasted like curry puff) were not bad. From an earlier visit, enjoyed the 잡채 japchae (stir fried glass noodles and vegetables) and the 김치전 kimchijeon (kimchi pancake).

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content: A great Korean Chinese restaurant that serves my favorite Jjampong and sweet and sour pork. I definately will be back to try this great Chinese food.

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content:
Chose the 2 pax set (actually can feed 3) which is what most people eat here. Priced at $53++. Honestly I’ve had better jjampong and jajangmyeon noodles (more Q and softer) in other korean restaurants thus wouldnt come back for the noodles though we love the spicy jjampong soup and the generous ingredients given.

Their sweet and sour pork is however a good huge portion and served hot from the kitchen which makes it even more tantalizing. Their fried dumplings are also crunchy and delicious.

The sides are pretty minimal (guess you leave more stomach space for the mains) but the kimchi is good.

Pretty cosy and small space that is family run and service is great. Complimentary water is served as well.

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content: Cosy little place serving nice korean food ! Very big portions and we can’t really finish our food. The staff were really friendly and would offer to split food into our bowls. Prices are on the higher side so while I would come back, I wouldn’t come back often. Music are a bit loud at times so could be hard to converse at times.

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content:
Been a while since we had usual gathering there till yesterday for the party of 10 Koreans who has abt 10yrs average life in Singapore.
Unlike previous experiences, there are big disappointments to all of us .
- service is really sluggish. Had to press buttons multiple times to get someone come to check.
- food is in general too salty. We asked less salty after tasting first two dishes, but it didn't work despite over 10 dishes we tried.
- Manager is seems having no customer caring attitude. She even turned back although we didn't finish our requests/orders.

We spent over $1.1K including the service charge of over $100 for this type of service and food.
All really got disappointed.

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content:
Service (5/5): Good restaurant service. Prompt and welcoming. Has the standard korean small dishes and water, both refillable. Range of small dishes is not the largest, but good enough.

Food (5/5): We ordered the set A - 5 dumplings, sweet and sour pork, and choice 2x, either Jjajamyeon or Jjamppong. We got 2 Jjamppong.
The dumplings are nice, with vegetable and meat fillings, in particular, liked the sauce that comes with it. Reminds me of Xiao Long Baos.
The sweet and sour pork was great as well - the sauce was served at the side so that the pork remains crispy after some time. The sauce pairs very well with the pork.
I liked the soup of the jjamppong, and the seafood is quite plentiful. The noodles are normal to me, but the portion is huge.

Value (4.5/5): Price is not exactly cheap, but reasonable for the quality and quantity of the food.

Others: This isn't your trendy kpop kind of place, but rather relaxing, classy kind of place. One thing i picked up immediately when I entered was that they played instrumental music. Also, noticed there were quite a number of koreans in the shop.

Overall (5/5): Great food, reasonably priced. If you are in the location, worth a visit. I wouldn't mind going back for the same food, or try out new ones.

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content:
LOVE THE FOOD!! Set for 2 costs $53++. Can choose 2 bowls of noodles (jampong and/or jjm), tang su yuk and 5 dumplings. Idk where to begin....i rly love the food here.

The jampong was full of seafood flavour and lots of seafood given. About 4 or 5 mussels, prawn, octopus. Noodles were of great texture. The jjm was light and not jelat at all. Managed to finish the entire bowl.

The fried dumplings were crispy. The tang su yuk! It was served freshly fried. And even when it was cold thru the meal, the pork and batter did not turn hard. Finished it too!

Omg i feel like eating it now.

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content: Surprisingly, the Korean Chinese fusion was pretty good. It is located next to the main road, which doesn't get it much attention as cars and human traffic just breezes by, until my friend recommended it to me. Their kimchi pancake is good. Their jja jang myeong is good. The jjamppong is good. Fried dumplings are alright. Sweet and sour chicken could be better, maybe pork would have been a better order. The soju and makggeoli just washed everything down well. Had a super full meal by the end of it all.

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content: The food is AMAZING. Idk what’s it called, but yknw like zi char sweet & sour pork , they have it here but it taste SO DIFFERENT from the zi char kind. I had the ja jiang mian, the noodle is soooo good. Sorry I don’t rmb the names of the dishes 🙃 My friend said usually the place is crowded but that day I went was alright. Will definitely come back here!!

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content:
Had a lovely evening at this Korean Chinese restaurant with my friends. Food was amazing. One of the best 짬뽕 in Singapore. 탕수육 was savoury as well.

Do make a reservation as seats are limited

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content: We found the BEST jjamppong here in SG! The broth was flavourful and generous portion! The noodles they used had nice textures! The tang su yuk was lacking in terms of the batter. Jjm was ok. I dabao jjm home and still not clumpy! Definitely coming back for the jjamppong!!!

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content: Best Sweet and Sour Beef (Tangsuyook) I had in Singapore! Love the sauce! Strongly recommend with Jjajangmyun! Great food. Fast service and cozy atmosphere. Recommended by a friend who said that this is one of the best Korean Chinese restaurants in Singapore.

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content: First time here. Ordered jajangmyeon n Jjampong only as the 2 of us couldn't finish too much. Noodles are springy. Jajang sauce is just right, sweet but not overwhelming. Jjampong soup has alot of seafood freshness taste but as non spicy takers, we find it abit spicy but still find it very addictive. Overall, we considered them one of the best Jjampong n jajangmyeon in Singapore.

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content:
Saw the good reviews here and decided to try. But Honestly, I found the food very mediocre. I thought jjajang was alright, but I felt Dong Fang Hong was much nicer. The Jjambong was very very average tasting..

However, I agree that the noodles used for the Jjajang and Jjambong were very nice and chewy and it is their pride, despite the sauce and soup being pretty so so.

Tangsuyuk was alright? The pork was pretty tough and not really marinated thoroughly. Mandu was also average..

I think overall for $50++ for set A.. I think I rather patronise another stall based on taste of food alone. But service was good and quick.

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content: Good korean food near maxwell food center. Lots of koreans patronising this restaurant as well. Spent around $90++ for 5 people, price is decent for alacarte mains. They also provide the standard radish and kimchi side dishes. Overall good experience.

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content: Cozy place with amazing decor. Easily located near Red Dot Design Museum, this is the place to go for authentic Korean-Chinese food! Came here with my friends recently and they are already asking to meet up there again! Special thumbs up for the 탕수육 (sweet and sour pork)!! Set meal which consists of jajangmyeon, jjamppong, tangsuyeok and mandu, is perfect for sharing! ^^ Will definitely be back again!

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content:
First time trying Korean Chinese food, so can't comment much.

I would say the food is 70% Korean and 30% Chinese.

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content: Tangsuyuk, sweet and sour pork is the best. Come many times to try this dish.

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content: Would have given 0 star I could even do that. Horrible experience and service at the restaurant. Twice they messed my reservations and were not apologetic about it. Even though they might have seats, they would rather entertain walk in from Koreans, than offer the seats to us. We had a heavily pregnant diner in our group and all they can tell us is go stand elsewhere and not block them while they check what went wrong (which obviously was not solved). So if you are local, don’t bother to reserve because they won’t honor the reservation anyway, and will put the blame on you. Twice it was messed up by their Filipino staff Aida (sorry not sure how to spell her name so got to say her nationality but they only have 1 Filipino staff) so just be careful even if you still want to proceed to reserve. Make sure you check if it’s her, if yes, please ask for another staff to prevent yourself the agony of standing in the restaurant and getting maligned and blamed for their own staff mistake. Go at your own risk (of spoiling your plan and mood). Honestly, there are other better options just around with much friendlier staff and better service like Itaewon Jjajang, or even obba jjajang!

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content: Love their dumplings..their portion is rather generous and taste is good (not salty and oily). Service is prompt too.

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content: Nothing really fantastic in my opinion. I tried Set A with fried dumpling, sweet sour pork, black bean sauce noodles and seafood soup noodles. Dumpling is quite tasty but overall I feel that the food is only average. Service is still good. Price is on the high side. Sweet sour pork smallest is $28. Wanted to try jelly fish salad but it’s $38. In my opinion only worth going once to try, unlikely to return again.

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content:
Delicious jjajang and jjampong. Everything was so good that we ordered another set for second round 🤩
Recommend to make reservations before heading down to avoid waiting.

Can’t wait to be back the next time!!! 🤤

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content: Very authentic korean taste!! The jjajangmyeon was very good indeed! Will be back!

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content: One of the best korean Chinese restaurants in SG.

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content: Quality food and good service. A reminder to make reservation before going

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content:
One of the best Korean restaurant in Singapore! The spicy seafood noodle soup (jjambong) and black bean paste noodle (jjajang myeon) is great. The noodle itself is chewy, taste as great as freshly handmade noodle! The jjambong soup is so flavourful, it just make me crave for more even I'm a person who can't really takes spicy food.

The tangsuyok also taste great. You can tell the greatness just by the smell of the fried pork! With the layer of sweet and sour source, it's just heavenly!

Definitely coming back for more!

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content: Had their Set A (tasungyuk, jjajangmyun, jjampong and mandoo) and it was delicious! Tangsuyuk was really tasty and best jjampong I have ever eaten. Recommended!

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content: Very disappointed that the staff mixed up my reservation despite calling and making the reservation 2 weeks in advance. Even called in the afternoon to confirm and the staff confirmed my request. Only to receive a call later on from an impatient staff telling me that my request was not able to be catered for. I'm disappointed by your service, hwang sil. We were looking forward to enjoying Korean food with our Korean colleagues.

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content: Super authentic Korean Chinese noodle place. One of the best in Singapore. Definitely going back!

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content: A place to go for Korean food! Pancake is especially nice.

restaurant name: Hwang Sil Jjajang Jjampong specialty restaurant
content: Jjampong was delicious but a tad too spicy for me.  The spicy fried chicken taste ($35!) was good but the batter was a little too soggy for my liking.

The food here is seriously excellent. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a good, nice Chinese meal. The caramelized eggplant is a must order. The wagyu steak was fantastic as well, very melt in your mouth. Dessert wise, I had the mixed tangyuan which was amazing. Service could be a little better, felt a little cold. Maybe it was just that day. Nonetheless I would still go back!

An east-meets-west fusion restaurant at the Maxwell Chambers Suites.
The food looks simple but it is unique and delicious. Every private dining room is directly accessible from the passageway outside.
There is ample parking behind the building, though a little dark and quiet at night.

Led by celebrity chef Heman Tan, Szechuan food is yummy and authentic. 辣子鸡was nicely cooked, not oily and spices and spicy level just nice. The eggplant was amazing nice, crisp on the outside and soft and tender on the inside, coated nicely caramelised.

Five of us had the Xmas menu. Pretty disappointing as the portions were quite small and food quality was so so. I used to like Xi Yan a lot but haven’t had a chance to go back since Covid. But I realised the quality and food portions has shrunk considerably. We are not big eaters but despite a 6 course lunch, we still felt like we were not full. Hope that they do improve but hard for me to revisit again for the quality at this price point.

The food tastes good, but there wasn't the wow factor i was hoping for.  Service is attentive but standard. Place very cold, just feel like quickly leave the place after the meal. Prawns for peng cai do not taste well, manager said it could be overcooked n apologise for it.

Huge menu, very friendly service staffs and owners and lots of wine tasting events.

Food is good and experimental. Overall, a very friendly place.
Very classic restaurant inside an old building maxwell chamber. Restaurant are well decorated n food are fusion type.

Another excellent meal here.
Service is efficient and friendly.
Reasonably priced.

Ordered the $108++/pax set dinner. Gone are its glory days when it's food is mind-blowing in terms of taste & creativity. To be fair, then it was still a private dining place, and it was more than 10 years ago. I was so wow that I went to the HK branch when I was over there.

Now it is just an ordinary restaurant dishing out boring fusion stuff. It's execution can be better as well. The only ok dish was the platter. The best is the soaked cherry. But this was an early creation since private dinning days, except that it has shrunk in size.  The rest of the dishes were so under-whelming. 1 star is for the food. One main reason was that the food tasted like a typical Chinese restaurant. Why would I pay so much to eat something so ordinary. Xi Yan 不再是昔日的 Xi Yan, 可惜可惜。

The service was good; attentive & friendly staff.

We are honored to be invited to a wine pairing dinner at Xi Yan by Wine List Asia.

The theme of the food for that night was Chinese food fusion with some Japanese elements. It went well with wine from Satori and we all had a insightful discussion on how each of the wine has its own unique characteristics and how versatile they were.

What I like about the restaurant is it’s interior decor and personal collection of porcelains, pottery and tea ware of the owner.w

We enjoyed the dinner with great company and good wine from Satori by Wine List Asia. The wines made the food enjoyable.
I luv the Pao fan and vege..

Best “yusheng lohei” I have ever tasted. 5 kinds of fish, octopus, ikura; with all organic vegetables & fruits complimented with special plum sauce that’s not too sweet & really refreshing on the palette. This dish alone is worth 5 stars ⭐️!
Signature fish soup with rice crackers was spot on too. A must try here.
Special chicken, Wagyu beef, Boston lobster noodle, dessert were all very good. Such an enjoyable dinner.

Great food at great value!
Attended a wine pairing dinner, superb!

Get the Blanched Red Grouper w Seafood Pepper Stock (Infused with Lobster, Prawns & Crabs). Topped with crackling crispy rice when it hits the soup. Skip the truffles and stick to the traditional Chinese dishes imo. A little on the pricier end for Chinese food but well worth the money.

I have been to Xi Yan more than 10 years ago at its own craig road branch and i never forget the experience. I like the way they make chinese cuisine fusion and yet did not lose the identify of the dish. So when i was deciding where to go to celebrate my family member birthday, i choose Xi Yan.

It was for a friday lunch and choices were between Xi Yan and other Hotels' chinese restaurants lunch menus. Xi Yan stood out immediately because it offers more variety and at a much affordable cost. Parking is also easy because Maxwell Chamber has its own car park. Car Park rebate comes with the dining.

The staff are very attentive and took very nice photos of us! Knowing how to take with right angle and background.

When i casually mentioned it was to celebrate birthday, they surprised us with the longevity bun!

It was still as good as 10 years ago and if not, it got better!

Service is impeccable. The cooking style for the food is interesting but IMO, no wow factor. Yu sheng is too fusion to my liking and having rocket leaves left a bitter taste to the yu sheng - not very appropriate considering this is supposed to be an auspicious dish? Can't say much about the white bee hoon as well - it is tasty but no wow factor. The grilled pork combi with the pineapple is refreshing though.

The food was tasty and the ambiance was privatize . We had our dinner here and its like a 'omakase' style . Where the chef prepare whatever that suits your taste . Please advice your preference of dietary and style .Booking only... No walk in ....
Great food and very attentive staff! There were a few fusion Chinese dishes like the truffle chicken which we enjoyed.The tomato starter was unique!

One of my favorite Cantonese restaurant in town. They hv moved from Craig Rd to Maxwell Chambers Suites. The new venue of their flagship outlet is more spacious n cosy in a convenient downtown location. N there's is an added bar serving good range of cocktails n hard liquors. As usual, staff r very friendly n attentive, service is excellent.
Amazing tasting food, creatively done for a nice twist on traditional Chinese dishes. Reasonable prices as well for CBD.
Great ambience and very attentive staff! Amazing crab bee hoon, easy to eat fried chicken. Tomato starter was interesting.
Another restaurant with good food and service. Good choice for a business lunch as the wait staff are well trained and Super attentive. Favourite dish was the tomato starter!
Hosted a number of dinners this week at the restaurant. Tried the ala carte as well as the set menu. Service and quality of food exceptional, wine conduct first class.
Superb food that excites the tastebud. Although they said fusion, it is very much varied Asian style n ingredient blend into one
Always love their version of the Yu Sheng.
The food was pleasing to the palate and we appreciated the warm and meticulous service. Our server was Andrew; props to him.

Very unpleasant experience dining here. We booked a table for Chinese New Year Eve for the first sitting at 530pm, for an 8 course meal. The first course arrived at 630pm and by 730pm we were only at our 4th course. The remainder of the 4 courses were rushed in the last 30mins and we finished dinner at 845pm. The second sitting started at 8pm and we were also asked to move our table to accommodate more guests. Food was average. Would not recommend this restaurant for any event, unless the aim is for a long and ardous meal with poor service. The restaurant should not take more reservations than they can manage.

Due to the Covid-19 situation we tried their take-away menu and it was absolutely fantastic.
We could taste the care about ingredients, the research behind every plate. A selection of the very best of Chinese/Thai cuisine. Very happy.

Our favourite private dining restaurant. Great service & good food. We love the signature Yu Sheng, the Kagoshima Wagyu beef, the Tomatoes in wasabi sesame sauce & the Angel Hair tofu soup. Also try the Truffle Chicken, the seafood white bee hoon & the Pregnant woman's fried rice. Delicious! Great selection of wine & whiskey.

Really love the place. Quite n wonderful food. Looks like pte dinning. Good food, love the Truffle chick n the deep fried fish. A must try! Price slightly on the high side or mayb we the captain recommended  too many. Overall.... will go again

Dinner last Sunday 27th Oct: Thank you Xi Yan Maxwell for a most memorable dinner and evening!
Fine dining restaurants can sometimes be snotty and not usually so relaxed or comfy, but at Xi Yan Maxwell other than the excellent modern Chinese food to rival some of the best on offer in Singapore (crab beehoon 10/10), it was also very well priced for an unforgettable dinner in a very relaxed yet trendy setting. My birthday party group of 33 were made to feel very special with good attentive service that was not overwhelming - no pushiness to buy drinks, although I must say the wines are so completely affordable compared to the much higher prices you pay elsewhere for the same. We were a bit noisy but with our separated dining area, I am sure nobody noticed. When the cake was brought in I could hear guests outside the open door clapping - the restaurant arranged a very impressive one. It is this homeliness that I like about Xi Yan. Thanks once again for taking great care of us. We will be back again and again.
Food is pretty nice. Yu Sheng was refreshingly different...  fresh salad leaves and 3 types of raw fish instead of the preserved stuff. No shell fish to trigger allergic reactions..

Poor environment. The restaurant did not control what kind of liquor that the customers bring in. And allow the customers to drunk and make a lot of loud noises. Affecting the rest of the customers. The manager did not even do the job by controlling. This restaurant is poor to have your fine dining here. Look elsewhere if you want to have a good dinner.

Arguably the best Chinese restaurant for foodies!! Amazing food; guaranteed to leave you and your guests satisfied and wanting to return for more.

So happy that Xi Yan has opened a new restaurant offering even more to please every diner. With the best of private dining favourites and improvised casual dining selection dishes, I was so impressed, I returned to the restaurant every week for the next 4 weeks.
To be fair, I have been a fan of Xiyan and I was delighted that with this new dining concept, I can  choose all dishes ala carte and not just Omakase - i personally prefer that accessibility.)

Here’s my die-die must try otherwise go back again list:
- Starters: Cold Okra, Century Egg Pitan Tofu and Signature Tomatoes
- Basil Wine Clams with korean glass noodles (my FAVOURITE dish. Clams preferred over the prawns since you get more from drinking the broth out of all the clam shells)
- Prawns: I’m torn between the ‘lighter’ Truffle Prawn with Egg White and more ‘exciting’ Kimchee cheese prawn
- Fish: Pomelo Fish (can never go wrong with this) and Garoupa slices with Crispy Rice in Broth (broth is amazing, a bit on the peppery side so if you have young kids, might want to ask them to go easy on pepper)
- Kagoshima Wagyu Beef  (I looooove the tangy green sauce)
- Dongbo Pork Belly Pyramid (my teenage nephews were all over this dish)
If it’s your first time there, try the Salivating Chicken. But I would try the others that are not on the casual dining menu first, especially if you have limited tummy space cos there’s really so much on the menu that needs to be gradually explored.
Once again, kudos to them, they manage to make every dish such a deliciously memorable experience.
An impromptu lunch.
I like the modern twist of chinese food here . Xi Yan is added to my "I-shall-return" list.
Pricey but delicious. Inexperienced staff but still gd service.

Recently booked a lunch slot a week before the date and the slot was confirmed. Nothing else was mentioned by the booking staff and the staff also did not mention there were 2 sittings.
Two days before the lunch, i was told that my slot for lunch as 11am to 1230.
I think this is very out of ordinary for a weekday lunch and I think it should have been told when the booking is confirmed, and not days before the lunch.
Awesome truffle chicken. One of the best Chinese restaurants to have a private wine dinner. My recent fave Chinese restaurant.
Nice and unique food but best of all they played my favourite Kit Chan songs in the background making the restaurant even more classy!
Very fine touches make even normal sounding dishes sing. Paired with great service it is a Michelin starred restaurant waiting to be awarded.

When visiting I usually stay at Sofitel City. Used to eat at Xi Yan in HK for imaginative and delicious modern Chinese food. The new Xi Yan Maxwell with a great bar is also truly amazing. Next to Tanjong Pagar MRT
Melts in my mouth. Mizayaki beef.
The food here doesn’t fail to satisfy at all, with a large number of hidden gems on the menu. Superb food from this outlet too — as always!
Interesting food and nicely plated. Recommended if you are interested to be delighted by innovative food that tastes good for a medium range price
Food is average but service and ambiance good. Rather pricey. 1-for-1 corkage
Good food attentive service
Nice and delicious food
Excellent foods. Good service. Average ambient for the price.
Very posh food is good portions just nice..Good food excellent for business talk.

If you like old school Chinese dumplings but don’t want to Din Tai Feng, there is always Jing Hua. The shop is well known for its so-called Chinese pizza (三鲜盒子). However, I would like to recommend that you try the pan fried dumplings (三鲜锅贴). You can see both in the pictures below. They also have a lot of frozen dumplings available for take-away, which is quite popular here. Of course they also have many of the usual suspects, but why not try something different? Service is fine and the price is reasonable. My only gripe would be that they do the usual Chinese restaurant scammy thing and charge for wet towels. To be fair, they’re probably more like 3.5 stars that four, but I’m not willing to round down to three here. The dumplings are pretty tasty and satisfying.

it was a very interesting place. I love the chinese pancake with meat in it. their fried rice was really good. you can notice the individual grain of rice. the dumplings were good. but the xiaolongbao was not good. the skin tear up easily and the broth just leaked all out. they should improve from there.
Chinese pizza, steamed/ pan fried dumplings were all good! Zha jiang noodle was a peanut sauce instead of meat sauce so a tad sweet for my liking. No frills, small menu and consistent :)

A surprise find along Neil Road is Jing Hua Xiao Chi. After the huge disappointment previously at the nearby Maxwell Hawker Centre for Wo Tie (Pot Stickers), a find just 5 mins walk away managed to wash away that disappointment.

Opened in 1989, this local homegrown restaurant specialises in traditional Chinese Dumplings and other Chinese Appetisers. All the dishes and Dumplings are handmade and not factory prepared. Decided to order some takeaway food to sample their dishes.

The Pan-Fried Mixed Seafood & Pork Dumplings were exquisite. The skin was pan-fried and seared to have a light crunch while keeping the juices of the meat within. When paired with the vinegar and ginger strips, it was so good.

The other item ordered was the Chinese Pizza. Yes, the name is somewhat misleading. It is like a cross between a Pastry Pie and the Pork Dumplings. It was an interesting dish and just as enjoyable as the Pork Dumplings.

From the above, this restaurant is definitely a go to place for future cravings of Wo Tie (Pot Stickers).

General Verdict: Traditional Chinese Appetisers done well and done properly for a wonderful gastronomical experience
